blog.name: destinyiartthou
blog.title: What Pleases Me
blog.description: I’m Transgender and I’m not out publicly and do answer to most pronouns if people are being respectful. Gender really never meant much to me personally - I certainly was never raised or ever thought one sex was weaker or less respectable in any way than the others (my mom and aunts were very independent people and raised me). I’m a gamer (video and pen/paper RPGs like DnD) and occasionally try to write. I also think wayyyyy too freakin much. This tumblr holds the images and views I enjoy along with the occasional thoughts I want to air (mostly to the void). No disrespect to original artists. Let me know if something should be removed or tagged better. Blogging from within Alberta, Canada. Porn and TERF blogs will be reported and blocked. Sites derogatory to Transgender people will also be blocked ... enough with the “you are a man but dress as a woman” crap. The whole point is about NOT being a man in the first place.

body:
Oh my goddess - so good!

The Unicorn Store with Brie Larson was so good and I’m not even sure why … except it hit so many buttons for me. I think it is just one of those films you need to experience and it touches you and restores some hope?! She was so good In it. I love her smiles. They are so warm and sincere.

I loved it. I cried. I loved it some more - just cause.

Watch it. It’s on Netflix ( also directed by her - I didn’t realize that before).

summary: You were easily one of Brie’s biggest supporters. You were there for every movie, every award show, and every relationship she...
body:
“Good Friends” A Brie Larson imagine

You were easily one of Brie’s biggest supporters. You were there for every movie, every award show, and every relationship she was involved with. Even though supporting her to the level you did easily qualified you for perfect significant other status, you and Brie were just best friends. Yes, you had more than friend feelings for Brie, but you could never tell her. The thought of her not reciprocating your feelings was bad enough, but thinking about her not being apart of your life anymore hurt much worse. So, you kept your feelings to your self.

You stood on set of Brie’s newest movie, watching her intently. Her character was getting into a heated argument with Tom Holland’s Spider-Man. It always amazed you to watch Brie act. It was like she was truly becoming Carol Danvers and it was amazing to watch.

“Cut! Great job, everyone. That’s it for the day, be back here tomorrow at the same time.” The director yelled before quickly turning his attention to who you assumed were a few producers.

Brie and Tom hugged before saying their own goodbyes. As soon as Brie turned around her eyes locked on you and a smile spread across her face. Within seconds she was standing in front of you.

“How was that? Did it look convincing?”

“Of course it did! You’re a great actress, Brie.”

“Thanks, y/n.” Brie pulled you into a hug, making your heart beat fast.

“We’re still meeting at yours for dinner, right?” She asked pulling away from the hug and disappointing you a little.

“Yeah we are. Six o’clock sharp, don’t be late.”

“I wouldn’t miss it for the world. I have to take this off and run home to walk my dogs, but I’ll be there on time.”

“I’m holding you to it, Larson.” Brie playfully rolled her eyes and grinned at you.

“Bye y/n.”

“Bye Brie.” You waited until Brie walked off set to walk out to your car. As you drove off the lot, you couldn’t help but think about your best friend.

When you arrived home you put all your attention towards making dinner. Even though you two spent a lot of time together at work and in your personal lives, it was rare for you to spend time together with just you two. So, on that rare occasion you had alone time together, you wanted to make it fun and special.

You made Brie’s favorite dinner and figured out how to make her favorite margaritas. As you finished mixing the margaritas there was a knock on the front door. Quickly, you wiped your hands and ran over to the door. You expected to see Brie with that huge smile you loved so much. Instead, you were greeted by a rare frown.

“Hey y/n.” She said with a forced happiness in her voice.

“Hey, what’s wrong?”

“Can I come in? This isn’t a conversation I want to have out in the open.”

“Yeah of course.” You stepped to the side and allowed Brie to walk into your home. Once the door was closed she let out a loud sigh.

“I just found out I have to move to London next month. The studio already has my apartment picked out and everything.”

“Oh…I thought you wouldn’t have to leave until after New Years. But that’s awesome, Brie.” Now it was your turn to force the fake happy tone.

“That’s what i thought too. Apparently some location schedules are changing so that’s why I have to leave so soon. I also have to live there for a year and a half now.”

“Wow, that’s a long time to be away from home. But I’m sure you’ll be fine since Zach will want to visit you all the time.”

“I actually broke up with Zach last week. I was going to tell you but you seemed really busy with work.”

“Oh. I’m sorry, Brie.”

“Don’t worry about it. I didn’t love him or anything…I actually have feelings for someone else.”

‘Here we go again’ you thought to yourself. Brie was going to tell you about another guy who didn’t put the time and effort she deserved.

“Yeah? Who’s the lucky guy?”

“It’s um…”

“Let me guess, Jason from production design?”

“No.”

“Mark from cinematography?”

“No.”

“That waiter from-“

“It’s you.” Brie almost mumbled while looking like a scolded puppy. It felt like a slap in the face, truly taking you by surprise.

“W-What?”

“I have feelings for you. I’ve had them for a while, but I was afraid you wouldn’t feel the same way and it would ruin our friendship. Judging by your reaction, I have ruined our friendship.”

“No you haven’t! I-I like you too.”

“Really?”

“Yes really. I’ve liked you for a solid two years now, but I was afraid if I told you, you would hate me and we wouldn’t be friends anymore.”

“Two years? You listened to me ramble about the guys I’ve dated for two years all while you had feelings for me?!”

“Well yeah. You sounded happy and I didn’t want to mess that up.”

“Oh y/n.”

Brie carefully approached you and pulled you into a tight hug. You held onto Brie like it was the last time you would ever see her. Your best friend pulled away from the hug, breaking your heart a little more. But, as soon as her hands fell, she quickly held your hands.

“Do you want to come to London with me?” Brie asked, her eyes darting around your face to see your reaction.

“Are you serious?”

“Yeah, I am. Everyone knows we’re best friends and you work for the studio so it won’t be weird if we live together. Plus if we want to…explore our feelings, there won’t be as many paparazzi to catch us on dates.” You felt a lump develop in your throat as your chest tightened. You wanted this for so long, but it felt too sudden and reckless to be real.

“Brie, are you sure? What if things don’t work out between us romantically?”

“Then we’ll work to be friends again. I want you in my life forever, y/n. Even if it means only being friends.” Your best friend looked at you with wide eyes. You could tell she genuinely meant what she said but also nervous about it.

“Okay, I’ll come with you.”

Brie smiled with her squinty smile you loved so much. She pulled you in for another hug, holding you a little less tight than before. You didn’t know if the move to London would damage your relationship or make it better. Either way, you were excited to experience something new with Brie.

“Okay, I’ll come with you.”

Brie smiled with her squinty smile you loved so much. She pulled you in for another hug, holding you a little less tight than before. You didn’t know if the move to London would damage your relationship or make it better. Either way, you were excited to experience something new with Brie.
trail.content:
“Good Friends” A Brie Larson imagine

You were easily one of Brie’s biggest supporters. You were there for every movie, every award show, and every relationship she was involved with. Even though supporting her to the level you did easily qualified you for perfect significant other status, you and Brie were just best friends. Yes, you had more than friend feelings for Brie, but you could never tell her. The thought of her not reciprocating your feelings was bad enough, but thinking about her not being apart of your life anymore hurt much worse. So, you kept your feelings to your self.

You stood on set of Brie’s newest movie, watching her intently. Her character was getting into a heated argument with Tom Holland’s Spider-Man. It always amazed you to watch Brie act. It was like she was truly becoming Carol Danvers and it was amazing to watch.

“Cut! Great job, everyone. That’s it for the day, be back here tomorrow at the same time.” The director yelled before quickly turning his attention to who you assumed were a few producers.

Brie and Tom hugged before saying their own goodbyes. As soon as Brie turned around her eyes locked on you and a smile spread across her face. Within seconds she was standing in front of you.

“How was that? Did it look convincing?”

“Of course it did! You’re a great actress, Brie.”

“Thanks, y/n.” Brie pulled you into a hug, making your heart beat fast.

“We’re still meeting at yours for dinner, right?” She asked pulling away from the hug and disappointing you a little.

“Yeah we are. Six o’clock sharp, don’t be late.”

“I wouldn’t miss it for the world. I have to take this off and run home to walk my dogs, but I’ll be there on time.”

“I’m holding you to it, Larson.” Brie playfully rolled her eyes and grinned at you.

“Bye y/n.”

“Bye Brie.” You waited until Brie walked off set to walk out to your car. As you drove off the lot, you couldn’t help but think about your best friend.

When you arrived home you put all your attention towards making dinner. Even though you two spent a lot of time together at work and in your personal lives, it was rare for you to spend time together with just you two. So, on that rare occasion you had alone time together, you wanted to make it fun and special.

You made Brie’s favorite dinner and figured out how to make her favorite margaritas. As you finished mixing the margaritas there was a knock on the front door. Quickly, you wiped your hands and ran over to the door. You expected to see Brie with that huge smile you loved so much. Instead, you were greeted by a rare frown.

“Hey y/n.” She said with a forced happiness in her voice.

“Hey, what’s wrong?”

“Can I come in? This isn’t a conversation I want to have out in the open.”

“Yeah of course.” You stepped to the side and allowed Brie to walk into your home. Once the door was closed she let out a loud sigh.

“I just found out I have to move to London next month. The studio already has my apartment picked out and everything.”

“Oh…I thought you wouldn’t have to leave until after New Years. But that’s awesome, Brie.” Now it was your turn to force the fake happy tone.

“That’s what i thought too. Apparently some location schedules are changing so that’s why I have to leave so soon. I also have to live there for a year and a half now.”

“Wow, that’s a long time to be away from home. But I’m sure you’ll be fine since Zach will want to visit you all the time.”

“I actually broke up with Zach last week. I was going to tell you but you seemed really busy with work.”

“Oh. I’m sorry, Brie.”

“Don’t worry about it. I didn’t love him or anything…I actually have feelings for someone else.”

‘Here we go again’ you thought to yourself. Brie was going to tell you about another guy who didn’t put the time and effort she deserved.

“Yeah? Who’s the lucky guy?”

“It’s um…”

“Let me guess, Jason from production design?”

“No.”

“Mark from cinematography?”

“No.”

“That waiter from-“

“It’s you.” Brie almost mumbled while looking like a scolded puppy. It felt like a slap in the face, truly taking you by surprise.

“W-What?”

“I have feelings for you. I’ve had them for a while, but I was afraid you wouldn’t feel the same way and it would ruin our friendship. Judging by your reaction, I have ruined our friendship.”

“No you haven’t! I-I like you too.”

“Really?”

“Yes really. I’ve liked you for a solid two years now, but I was afraid if I told you, you would hate me and we wouldn’t be friends anymore.”

“Two years? You listened to me ramble about the guys I’ve dated for two years all while you had feelings for me?!”

“Well yeah. You sounded happy and I didn’t want to mess that up.”

“Oh y/n.”

Brie carefully approached you and pulled you into a tight hug. You held onto Brie like it was the last time you would ever see her. Your best friend pulled away from the hug, breaking your heart a little more. But, as soon as her hands fell, she quickly held your hands.

“Do you want to come to London with me?” Brie asked, her eyes darting around your face to see your reaction.

“Are you serious?”

“Yeah, I am. Everyone knows we’re best friends and you work for the studio so it won’t be weird if we live together. Plus if we want to…explore our feelings, there won’t be as many paparazzi to catch us on dates.” You felt a lump develop in your throat as your chest tightened. You wanted this for so long, but it felt too sudden and reckless to be real.

“Brie, are you sure? What if things don’t work out between us romantically?”

“Then we’ll work to be friends again. I want you in my life forever, y/n. Even if it means only being friends.” Your best friend looked at you with wide eyes. You could tell she genuinely meant what she said but also nervous about it.

“Okay, I’ll come with you.”

Brie smiled with her squinty smile you loved so much. She pulled you in for another hug, holding you a little less tight than before. You didn’t know if the move to London would damage your relationship or make it better. Either way, you were excited to experience something new with Brie.
